intro: Mesosphaerum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Mesosphaerum hirsutum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
